titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Record Catalog Collection ARS.0184
titlestmt.author: Frank Ferko

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-03-09 12:12:37 -0800.

did.unittitle: Guide to the Record Catalog Collection
did.abstract: The Record Catalog Collection consists of published catalogs and other advertising materials issued by a wide variety of recording companies from around the world. In addition to catalogs, the materials include booklets, pamphlets, magazines, and loose sheets published between 1897 and 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research; material must be requested at least two business days in advance of intended use. Contact the Archive of Recorded Sound for assistance.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head Librarian, Archive of Recorded Sound, Braun Music Center, Stanford, California 94305. Consent is given on behalf of the Archive of Recorded Sound as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns.

prefercite.head: Cite as
prefercite.p: Record Catalog Collection. Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, CA.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders have been arranged alphabetically by record label name and then chronologically. Occasionally, more than one catalog, or type of catalog, was issued by a manufacturer within a single time period, so some folders have overlapping date ranges.
